Class: Fireadmin

Fireadmin

new Fireadmin(url)

Creates a Fireadmin object

Parameters:
Name Type Description
url String

Url of Firebase to use with Fireadmin
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 5
Example
//Create new Fireadmin Object
var fa = new Fireadmin("https://<your-app>.firebaseio.com");

Methods

accountByEmail(email, onSuccess, onError)

Get user account that is associated to a given email.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
email String

Email of account to retreive.
onSuccess function

Function that returns account info once it is loaded.
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error.
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 232
Example
fa.accountByEmail("test@test.com", function(account){
  console.log('Account loaded:' + account);
}, function(err){
 console.error('Error getting account by email:', err);
});

accountByUid(uid, onSuccess, onError)

Get account for a user given their uid.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
uid String

Unique Id for account.
onSuccess function

Function that returns account info once it is loaded.
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error.
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 211
Example
// Get account for uid: simplelogin:1
fa.accountByUid('simplelogin:1', function(account){
  console.log('Account for user with uid: ' + uid + ' is : ', account);
}, function(err){
   console.error('Error getting account for ' + uid + ' : ', err);
});

createObject(listName, objectData, onSuccess, onError)

Creates an object provided the name of the list the object will go into and the object itself. The object is created with a createdAt parameter that is a server timestamp from Firebase. If a user is currently signed in, the object will contain the author's $uid under the author parameter.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
listName String

The name of the list the object will be put into.
objectData Object

Data you wish to be contained within new object
onSuccess function

Function that runs when your object has been created successfully and returns newly created object.
onError function

Function that runs if there is an error creating the object.
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 44
Example
//creates new message object in message list
fa.createObject('messages', {title:Example, content:"Cool Message"}, function(newMsg){
 console.log('New Message created successfuly:', newMsg);
}, function(err){
 console.error('Error creating new message:', err);
});

emailAuth(loginData, onSuccess, onError)

Modified version of Firebase's authWithPassword that handles presence

Parameters:
Name Type Description
loginData object

Login data of new user
onSuccess function

Function that runs when the user is successfully authenticated with presence enabled.
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 71
Example
// Signin User with email and password
fb.emailAuth({email:test@test.com, password:'testtest'}, function(auth){
 console.log('Login Successful for user:', auth.uid);
}, function(err){
 console.error('Error logging in:', err);
});

fbRef(path)

Get a firebase reference for a path in array | string form

Parameters:
Name Type Description
path String | Array

relative path to the root folder in Firebase instance
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 299
Returns:

A Firebase instance

Example
//Array as path
var userRef = fa.fbRef(['users', uid]);

listByCurrentUser(listName, onSuccess, onError)

Gets list of objects created by the currently logged in User.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
listName String

The name of the list the objects will be grabbed from.
onSuccess function

Function that runs when the list has been retrieved successfully
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error.
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 101
Example
// Signin User with email and password
fb.listByCurrentUser("messages", function(messageList){
 console.log('List of messages by currently logged in user:', messageList);
}, function(err){
 console.error('Error getting message list:', err);
});

listByUid(listPath, Uid, onSuccess, onError)

Gets list of objects created by the currently logged in User.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
listPath String | Array

Required The name or path of the list the objects will be grabbed from.
Uid String

Required The Uid of the user that created objects.
onSuccess function

Not Required Function that runs when the list has been retrieved successfully
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Not Required Function that runs if there is an error.
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 131
Example
// Signin User with email and password
var uid = "simplelogin:1";
fb.listByUid("messages", uid, function(messageList){
 console.log('List of messages by ' + uid + ' : ', messageList);
}, function(err){
 console.error('Error getting message list:', err);
});

objectCount(listPath, onSuccess, onError)

Get count of objects in a given path or list

Parameters:
Name Type Description
listPath String | Array

The name or path of the list of which to count.
onSuccess function

Function that runs on completion of gathering list count.
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error.
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 154
Example
//String list name
fa.objectCount("users", function(count){
 console.log('There are ' + count + ' users');
});
//Array list path
fa.objectCount(['messages', messageId, 'comments'], function(commentCount){
 console.log('There are ' + commentCount + ' comments on the message with id: ' + messageId);
});

onlineUserCount(onSuccess, onError)

Get the number of users that are currently online.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
onSuccess function

Function that returns number of users currently online
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 189
Example
fa.onlineUserCount(function(count){
  console.log('There are ' + count + ' users currently online.');
});

setupPresence(uid)

Start presence management for a specificed user uid. This function is used within Fireadmin login functions.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
uid string

Unique Id for user that for which presence is being setup.
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 251

userCount(onSuccess, onError)

Get total user count

Parameters:
Name Type Description
onSuccess function

Function that returns total user count.
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error.
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 172
Example
fa.userCount("users", function(count){
 console.log('There are is a total of ' + count + ' users.');
});
